readme.title: README
readme.entries:
See readme.md for instructions on how to connect HAWGTS with your Home Assistant system. Follow the instructions below to setup your widget with the settings in this menu

1. Choose a theme. Change any theme settings or colors you'd like to make it your own, or skip this part
2. Set your device type, then toggle through the templates to see which one works for your layout and launcher
3. Set your entity_id(s) from Home Assistant

The widget should now be able to control your configured device. Once your first widget is complete, export it from KWGT to make copies of your customized widget for other devices

settheme.title: settheme
settheme.description: Select the theme to use on this widget. Open the "theme" folder below to customize it

devicetype.title: devicetype
devicetype.description: Select the type of device to control
devicetype.entries: DATA##"Select the type of device to control",light##Lights,climate##Climate,tv##Television,sound##Sound System,security##Security,lock##Doors and Locks,power##Charging and Battery,remote##Remote control,appliance##Home Appliances,home##Home Features?,electronics#Personal Electronics,maintence##Home Maintence,custom##Custom

templateselect.title: templateselect
templateselect.description: Select the layout template to use for your device(s)
templateselect.entries: DATA##"Select the layout template to use for your device(s)",1##Template 1,2##Template 2,3##Template 3,4##Template 4,5##Template 5,6##Template 6,0##Custom Template

fitmoreobj.title: fitmoreobj
fitmoreobj.description: Disable widget object count restrictions to use templates that are close to fitting. May cause overlap

theme.title: theme
theme.description: Override preset sizing and alignment variables

theme/themeinfo.title: THEME
theme/themeinfo.entries:
"Use this to override theme properties set by the theme JSON. This includes colors, sizing, padding, etc. All values in this folder are ignored when empty (unless otherwise indicated).

See readme for more information and JSON config"

theme/objsize.title: objsize
theme/objsize.description: (Preset to 90) - Size of the object rings

theme/deviceiconsize.title: deviceiconsize
theme/deviceiconsize.description: (Preset to 120) - Size of the Device Icon

theme/deviceiconrotation.title: deviceiconrotation
theme/deviceiconrotation.entries: DATA##"Rotate or flip the device icon on your Widget",NONE##0 Degrees,DEG90##90 Degrees,DEG180##180 Degrees,DEG270##180 Degrees,FLIP_X##Flip Vertically,FLIP_Y##Flip Horizontally

theme/ringshape.title: ringshape
theme/ringshape.description: Shape of the ring around the icons

theme/darkmode.title: darkmode
theme/darkmode.description: Enable/disable system dark mode. Override by editing and removing the formula

theme/shadow.title: shadow
theme/shadow.description: Enable/disable shadow. Override by editing and removing the formula

theme/cornerradius.title: cornerradius
theme/cornerradius.description: Radius of the widgets rounded corners

theme/objpaddingver.title: objpaddingver
theme/objpaddingver.description: Object padding between the two rows

theme/objpaddingside.title: objpaddingside
theme/objpaddingside.description: Padding from the edge of the box to the first icon

theme/advanced/boxtoggle.title: boxtoggle
theme/advanced/boxtoggle.description: Set the order of the boxes on your widget

theme/advanced/autoalign.title: autoalign
theme/advanced/autoalign.description: Turn off to override the following widget alignments

theme/advanced/widgetorient.title: widgetorient
theme/advanced/widgetorient.description: Set horizontal or vertical orientation of widget

theme/advanced/box1pos.title: theme/advanced/box1pos
theme/advanced/box1pos.entries: LEFT##Left - Horizontal Layout, RIGHT##Right - Horizontal Layout, TOP##Top - Vertical Layout, BOTTOM##Bottom - Vertical Layout

theme/advanced/box1size.title: box1size
theme/advanced/box1size.description: Override Box 1 size set from Flow

colors/themeinfo.title: themeinfo
colors/themeinfo.entries:
Use this to override color properties set by the theme JSON. All values in this folder are ignored when empty.

There is also a color generator to use your phone's system colors and an editor to modify colors

See readme for more information and JSON config

colors/ringrandom.title: ringrandom
colors/ringrandom.description: Random colors for the object ring. Must be configured in theme

colors/colorgen.title: colorgen
colors/colorgen.description: Generate colors for your widget from the system

colors/colorgen/info.title: info
colors/colorgen/info.entries:
Use this color generator to get colors from your device theme and modify them

This is based on "Material Design" specifications. So "Primary 80" should be Accent #1 + 80% tone. See specifications online and readme for more details.

Note: Background color opacity can also be set in the "theme" folder

You will have to copy the color to where you want to use it when generated

colors/colorgen/adjtone.title: adjtone
colors/colorgen/adjtone.description: Strength of color tone - 0 = Black, 100 = White

colors/colorgen/output.title: output
colors/colorgen/output.description: Color output. Tap to tweak and copy hex code to "colors" folder

colors/coloredit.title: coloredit
colors/coloredit.description: Edit colors for your widget from the theme or wallpaper

colors/coloredit/info.title: info
colors/coloredit/info.entries:
Use this color editor to modify the existing colors used in your theme, or extracted from your wallpaper

Select the color source you want to modify. Colors are from the selected theme or your overridden color, if set. Wallpaper colors are extracted from the device wallpaper by KWGT.

Note: Background color opacity can also be set in the "theme" folder

You will have to copy the color to where you want to use it once complete

colors/coloredit/editcolor.title: edit
colors/coloredit/editcolor.entries: back1##Background 1,back2##Background 2,objiconoff##Icon Off,objiconon##Icon On,cobjringoff##Ring Off,cobjringon##Ring On,border##Border Color,wpcolor1##Wallpaper Color 1,wpcolor2##Wallpaper Color 2,wpcolor3##Wallpaper Color 3

colors/coloredit/output.title: output
colors/coloredit/output.description: Color output. Tap to tweak and copy hex code to "colors" folder

entities/entitynote.title: entitynote
entities/entitynote.entries:
"ENTITY LIST

If you're only controlling one device, enter it in "entity1". If you're controlling more than one, enter them in the order they appear in the template. (1st device is "entity1", 2nd is "entity2", etc)"

external.title: external
external.description: Configure device icon and app icon apps to open

external/devicon.title: devicon
external/devicon.description: Select an app to open on touch: Device icon
external/devicon.entries: 1##This device in Home Assistant App,2##Home Assistant App,3##Home Assistant Assist,4##KWGT Editor (Great while configuring widget),5##Custom

external/appicon1.title: appicon1
external/appicon1.description: Select an app to open on touch: App icon #1
external/appicon1.entries: 0##Hidden,1##This device in Home Assistant App,2##Home Assistant App,3##Home Assistant Assist,4##KWGT Editor (Great while configuring widget),5##Custom

external/appicon2.description: Select an app to open on touch: App icon #2
external/appicon2.title: appicon2
external/appicon2.entries: 0##Hidden,1##This device in Home Assistant App,2##Home Assistant App,3##Home Assistant Assist,4##KWGT Editor (Great while configuring widget),5##Custom

external/appiconsize.title: appiconsize
external/appiconsize.description: (Preset to 32) Size of the small app-launcher objects

external/custom.title: custom
external/custom.description: Enter the Android package name to open (eg com.android.appname)

core.title: core
core.description: Core globals for status and tasker

core/tasker/fromtasker.title: fromtasker
core/tasker/fromtasker.description: State information sent from tasker to apply to "json/device"

core/tasker/status.title: status
core/tasker/status.description: Status and error messages from Tasker

core/tasker/temp.title: temp
core/tasker/temp.description: Temp storage for Tasker > KWGT flow

core/status/currentstatus.title: currentstatus
core/status/currentstatus.description: Current status or last status displayed

func/jsonmain.title: jsonmain
func/jsonmain.description: Load JSON data for following 3 global variables

func/jsonstate.title: jsonstate
func/jsonstate.description: Get the current state of devices. Call with #posid ".box1.row2.0"

func/alignment.title: alignment
func/alignment.description: Variables for use in alignment globals and objects

func/theme.title: theme
func/theme.description: Variables for use in theme globals and objects

func/devjsonadd.title: devjsonadd
func/devjsonadd.description: Device State - Add newlines and spaces to JSON

func/devjsonindent.title: devjsonindent
func/devjsonindent.description: Device State - Add indentation to JSON

func/devjsonnew.title: devjsonnew
func/devjsonnew.description: Device State - Add new entity to bottom of list

json/template.title: template

params.formula:
$lv(entity, tc(json, gv(core/tasker/fromtasker), ".entity_id"))$$lv(exists, if(tc(json, gv(json/device), "$.device_states[?(@.entity_id == '" + #entity + "')].entity_id") != "", 1, 0))$$lv(datawipe, tc(reg, tc(reg, gv(json/device), "
", ""), "\s", ""))$$lv(jsonwipe, tc(reg, tc(reg, gv(core/tasker/fromtasker), "
", ""), "\s", ""))$$lv(jsonrem, (if(#exists = 1, gv(func/devjsonrem), #datawipe)))$$lv(jsonout, tc(reg, #jsonrem, "\},\]\}", ("\}," + #jsonwipe + "\]\}")))$$lv(jsonline, gv(func/devjsonadd))$$lv(jarrcut, tc(split, tc(split, #jsonline, "[", 1), "]", 0))$$lv(jarredit, tc(reg,#jarrcut, "
", tc(utf, 0A) + "    "))$$lv(jaddspc, gv(func/devjsonindent))$$lv(jremblnk, tc(reg, #jaddspc, "\s
", ""))$$#jremblnk$

internal_formulas.position_anchor: $if(gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = RIGHT, BOTTOMLEFT, gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = LEFT, BOTTOMRIGHT,  gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = TOP, BOTTOMRIGHT,  gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = BOTTOM, TOPRIGHT)$
$if(gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = RIGHT, BOTTOMLEFT, gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = LEFT, BOTTOMRIGHT,  gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = TOP, BOTTOMRIGHT,  gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = BOTTOM, TOPRIGHT)$
$if(gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = RIGHT, TOPLEFT, gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = LEFT, TOPRIGHT,  gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = TOP, BOTTOMLEFT,  gv(theme/advanced/box1pos) = BOTTOM, TOPLEFT)$
